results.title: Antihypercholesterolemic and antioxidant efficacies of zerumbone on the formation, development, and establishment of atherosclerosis in cholesterol-fed rabbits
results.text_hl: In conclusion, our data indicated that dietary supplementation of ZER at doses of 8, 16, and 20 mg/kg alone as a prophylactic measure, and as a supplementary treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, significantly reduced early @<m>DISEASE_Plague</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010930 @@@plague@@@ formation, development, and establishment via significant reduction in serum @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@ profile, together with suppression of oxidative damage, and therefore alleviated @DISEASE_Atherosclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@atherosclerosis lesions@@@.

citations.NLM: Hemn HO, Noordin MM, Rahman HS, Hazilawati H, Zuki A, Chartrand MS. Antihypercholesterolemic and antioxidant efficacies of zerumbone on the formation, development, and establishment of atherosclerosis in cholesterol-fed rabbits Drug Des Devel Ther. 2015;9():4173-208. PMID: 26347047
